title: FDEM Alligator Alcatraz attorney contact emails

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All emails to or from the address "legal@privacy6.com" between July 2, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

An FDEM spokesperson provided the above email address in a July 15 Miami Herald story for attorney correspondence and scheduling at the "Alligator Alcatraz" detention center : https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/immigration/article310625140.html

Under Fla. Stat. § 119.0701(1)(a), private contractors are subject to public record law when they contract with public agencies and are acting on behalf of the public agency in providing those services.  

Please also note that when responsive records contain exempt material, the custodian must redact the applicable portions and release the rest of the records. “A person who has custody of a public record who asserts that an exemption applies to a part of such record shall redact that portion of the record to which an exemption has been asserted and validly applies, and such person shall produce the remainder of such record for inspection and copying.” Fla. Stat. § 119.07(1)(d) (2020)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

title: Request for Bodycam & Dashcam Footage – Arrest of Emekwanem Biosah (June 26, 2025, Harris County, TX)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam & Dashcam Footage – Arrest of Emekwanem Biosah (June 26, 2025, Harris County, TX)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, I hereby request the following records:

Request:
I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage related to the arrest of Emekwanem Ogugua Biosah (DOB: 03/29/1990) on or about June 26, 2025, at approximately 4:55 PM in Harris County, Texas.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

All body-worn camera video captured by officers involved in the arrest or pursuit of Mr. Biosah, including any footage captured by Officer C. Offord or other personnel involved.

Any dash cam footage from marked patrol vehicles participating in the pursuit or stop.

Footage of the vehicle operation, pursuit, signal to stop, and the immediate aftermath of the arrest.

As described in D.A. Log Number 3167769 (Cause No. 257089201010 002, Harris County Criminal Court at Law No. 3), Mr. Biosah was charged with Fleeing or Attempting to Elude a Police Officer, following a pursuit initiated with emergency lights by Officer C. Offord in a marked vehicle.

This request is being made for non-commercial, journalistic, and public interest purposes.

If there are any fees, please inform me in advance. I prefer to receive the responsive records in digital format (via email or secure download). If necessary, please redact any exempt portions rather than withholding entire records.

I request a response within the 10 business days allowed under Texas law.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Planning.

title: Energy and Innovation Summit

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Energy and Innovation Summit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Pennsylvania Energy and Innovation Summit took place July 15, 2025 at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in Pittsburgh, PA. Media reporting has indicated that the Secret Service was involved in discussions about a fence being painted on the CMU campus: https://triblive.com/local/fence-fight-cmu-orders-students-anti-trump-message-painted-over-ahead-of-presidents-visit/

I request the following information:

1) Email communications containing any of the terms (not case sensitive) "fence", "paint", "repaint", "re-paint", "no rapists on our campus", "protest the summit", or "stop the summit" sent to or from an email address ending in @cmu.edu, @andrew.cmu.edu, or any other subdomain of cmu.edu between July 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

2) All communications (including emails, calendar invites, meeting notes, and other correspondence) with Farnam Jahanian (including but not limited to farnam@cmu.edu, farnam@andrew.cmu.edu, or president@andrew.cmu.edu), Gina Casalegno (gina.casalegno@cmu.edu or ginac@andrew.cmu.edu), and Daryl Weinert (dweinert@cmu.edu or dweinert@andrew.cmu.edu) between June 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Weinshel

title: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

All Advisories, Suspicious Activity Reports, Tips, Intelligence Briefs, Intel Reports, Leads Information or Data, Maps, Bulletins, BOLOs, and/or Joint Bulletins from 1 June 2025 to the date this request is processed including the search term "epstein".

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. title: Esptein

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Esptein
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any internal or external communications -- including emails, text messages, and memoranda -- mentioning 
the key work "epstein" between June 1 2025 and the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a freelance reporter. As such, the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request.

Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

-Daniel Boguslaw

title: Prevented Mass Violence - Case Material from 2018 Everett, WA Arrest

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Prevented Mass Violence - Case Material from 2018 Everett, WA Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Police report, supplements, investigative case file, run notes, and CAD notes relating to the arrest of Joshua Alexander O'Connor in February of 2018. 
2) Photos/scans of any notebooks, manifestos, or documents produced by the arrested party.
3) Any remaining bodycam footage or media relating to the search of the arrested party's property.

The requested material will be used as part of a research effort on cases where incidents of mass violence were prevented by family and law enforcement. Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Shawn A

title: BAAQMD ALPR Review

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: BAAQMD ALPR Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to usage of Automated License Plate Recognition (ALPR) technology by the Bay Area Air Quality Management District, including static and vehicle-based cameras. This includes:

1) NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and contracts relating to the purchase and maintenance of ALPR systems owned/operated by the Bay Area Air Quality Management District
2) ALPR policies, procedures, guides, and training materials 
3)  The names of agencies and organizations with which the BAAQMD shared ALPR data in 2025
4) All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 1st, 2024 until the date of processing this request (An audit log of ALPR queries, time/date, identity/role, agency, and type of data accessed will suffice). If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
5) Any MOU or data sharing agreement which allows BAAQMD ALPR records to be shared or queried by non-BAAQMD personnel.
6) Any search warrants, subpoenas, or court orders BAAQMD has received for ALPR data. 

I appreciate your assistance. I'd be happy to chat and provide additional context to aid you in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A
